TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ToolStripStatusLabel extends System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLabel

Docs.summary: Represents a panel in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ToolStripStatusLabel is a version of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripLabel> designed specifically for use in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusStrip>. The special features include <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripStatusLabel.BorderStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripStatusLabel.BorderSides%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripStatusLabel.Spring%2A>.
A ToolStripStatusLabel can contain text or an icon that reflects the status of an application. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection> class to find, add, or remove ToolStripStatusLabel objects.
Although ToolStripStatusLabel replaces and adds functionality to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> control of previous versions, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.StatusBarPanel> is retained for both backward compatibility and future use if you choose.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates a ToolStripStatusLabel with various common properties set.

Gets or sets a value that determines where the is aligned on the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The meaning of the Alignment property is affected by the setting of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.RightToLeft%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Set the Spring property to `true` to enable the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripStatusLabel> to smoothly resize along with its container.
